clinical_study.brief_title: Study of Cobalt's Role in Excessive Erythrocytosis Among High Altitude Dwellers in Cerro de Pasco, Peru
clinical_study.official_title: Randomized Controlled Trial of N-acetylcysteine and Acetazolamide in Treatment of Chronic Mountain Sickness

brief_summary.textblock: Chronic mountain sickness is characterized by excessive red blood cell production which causes sludging of the vascular system. This high viscosity blood causes heart failure, cognitive dysfunction, and strokes. The investigators hypothesize that cobalt which has been previously been shown to be an environmental pollutant worsens the overproduction of red blood cells. The investigators plan to conduct a 6 week trial in which acetazolamide (already shown to improve chronic mountain sickness) and N-acetylcysteine (a drug that removes cobalt from the blood) are evaluated in their potential to improve chronic mountain sickness.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in Hematocrit, or fraction of plasma occupied by cellular elements at week 8
primary_outcome.description: Spun hematocrit measured on portable machine

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in arterial blood gas values at week 8
secondary_outcome.description: Analyzed using portable machine. The values analyzed include serum pH, partial pressure of carbon dioxide, partial pressure of oxygen, and serum bicarbonate.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline Erythropoietin at week 8
secondary_outcome.description: Serum hormone that stimulates red blood cell production

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in serum and urine Cobalt at day 3
secondary_outcome.description: Will calculate spot clearance of cobalt

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in baseline urine protein at 8 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Ratio of urine total protein to urine creatinine

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in baseline Chronic mountain sickness score at 8 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Chronic Mountain Sickness Score Absent Mild Moderate Severe Headache 0 +1 +2 +3 Dizziness 0 +1 +2 +3 Failing Memory 0 +1 +2 +3 Fatigue 0 +1 +2 +3 Breathlessness 0 +1 +2 +3 Sleep disturbances 0 +1 +2 +3 Tinnitus 0 +1 +2 +3 Anorexia 0 +1 +2 +3 Cyanosis of lips, face, or fingers 0 +1 +2 +3 Hyperemia or prominent capillaries conjunctivae or laryngopharynx 0 +1 +2 +3

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in baseline Serum electrolytes at day 3, 14 and week 8
secondary_outcome.description: Electrolytes, specifically monitoring serum potassium to treat serious hypokalemia (serum potassium < 3.0 meQ/L).

intervention.description: 1 (or 2 in the placebo group) empty gel capsules

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Males over 17 years of age
- Hematocrit > 70%
- Chronic Mountain Sickness score (CMS) > 6
- Able to give informed consent and follow instructions in written Spanish
Exclusion Criteria:
- CMS > 15
- Underlying lung disease, smoking, or oxygen therapy
- Asthma (bronchospasm can be caused by N-acetylcysteine)
- Phlebotomy in last 3 months
- h/o adverse reaction to acetazolamide or N-acetylcysteine
